summary: This is a letter from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP, representing Deutsche Bank, to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It transmits the eleventh production of documents in response to a grand jury subpoena dated July 11, 2019, concerning the bank's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The production includes records related to account onboarding, meetings, asset transfers, risk committees, cash withdrawals, wire transfers, and payments from Epstein-controlled entities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Client of Deutsche Bank, subject of investigation
persons.context: The central subject of the grand jury subpoena. The document details Deutsche Bank's records concerning his accounts, asset transfers, cash withdrawals, and payments from his entities like Gratitude America, Ltd. and LSJE, LLC.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Deutsche Bank
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to Deutsche Bank concerning its relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Transfer of Epstein's Assets from JP Morgan to Deutsche Bank
events.description: Bank records document the transfer of Jeffrey Epstein's assets from JP Morgan to Deutsche Bank during this period.

events.title: Email with List of Epstein's JP Morgan Accounts
events.description: An email from an accountant to an assistant attached a list of Jeffrey Epstein's JP Morgan accounts.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was responding to a July 11, 2019, grand jury subpoena regarding its financial relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, making its eleventh document production.
The production included records of large, routine cash withdrawals made by Jeffrey Epstein's attorney and accountant.
Records showed wire transfers from Epstein's charitable entity, Gratitude America, Ltd., to an entity referred to as 'the Foundation'.

An Epstein-controlled account, LSJE, LLC, was described in KYC records as a checking account for daily expenses of one of his private homes, with transactions suggesting it managed his Palm Beach estate.
The bank received trust documents for 'The 2017 Caterpillar Trust' during due diligence and identified payments to beneficiaries of a separate '2013 Butterfly Trust'.
